units.title: Generate mosaic cortical brain organoids (mCBOs)
units.text: pooling PSC lines (5,000 cells per line) before organoid generation and longitudinally profiled the resulting mCBOs through scRNA-seq at 50, 100 and 300 d of differentiation, following the same protocol previously used and benchmarked in our laboratory
units.rationale: This describes a clear experimental procedure for creating multiplexed organoids by pooling stem cells prior to differentiation.

units.title: Perform downstream multiplexing before scRNA-seq
units.text: CBOs were generated individually from the PSC lines and profiled at the same time points, pooling equal amounts of cells per line after organoid dissociation for single-cell library preparation.
units.rationale: This outlines a distinct protocol step for pooling cells after organoid generation but before library prep for sequencing.

units.title: Longitudinal scRNA-seq profiling of organoids
units.text: longitudinally profiled the resulting mCBOs through scRNA-seq at 50, 100 and 300 d of differentiation
units.rationale: This specifies actionable time points for sampling and sequencing organoids over development.

units.title: Assess proliferation rates in mosaic organoids
units.text: longitudinally assessed the proliferation rate of organoids derived from individual lines in two differentiation replicates through flow cytometry-based cell cycle analysis.
units.rationale: This is a direct protocol step involving a quantitative method to track cell proliferation over time.

units.title: Benchmark demultiplexing algorithms
units.text: The single-cell transcriptomics datasets generated from both mosaic and downstream multiplexed organoids at early, mid and late stages of differentiation (Fig. 1b) were demultiplexed using three different state-of-the-art algorithms available for genetic demultiplexing (demuxlet27, souporcell28, Vireo29).
units.rationale: This describes a standardized computational protocol for comparing existing tools on experimental data.

units.title: Develop SCanSNP for improved genotype deconvolution
units.text: we set out to develop a new method, SCanSNP (Fig. 3a), to overcome the observed limitations by (1) dividing the classification challenge into two steps, one for identity assignment and one for doublet detection and (2) measuring the genetic purity of each droplet to identify low-quality droplets and separate them from authentic doublets.
units.rationale: This details a novel computational protocol with specific, actionable steps for improving cell identity assignment.

units.title: Implement consensus call framework for demultiplexing
units.text: to consolidate deconvolution accuracy, we set a consensus call framework considering the strengths and weaknesses of each algorithm, including non-genetic-based tools for doublets and low-quality cell detection43,44, merging their outcomes into one combined output (Fig. 3b).
units.rationale: This defines a protocol for integrating multiple algorithms into a unified, robust output pipeline.

units.title: Validate demultiplexing with in silico multiplexed datasets
units.text: we benchmarked them with ground truth priors using (1) five in silico multiplexed datasets with varying degree of balance among genotypes and (2) two ad hoc experiments in which the different genotypes were barcode tagged before pooling.
units.rationale: This specifies validation protocols using simulated and empirically tagged data to test algorithm performance.

units.title: Confirm SCanSNP performance with barcode-tagged datasets
units.text: The superior performance (comparison against cell ranger multi; Methods) delivered by SCanSNP was confirmed in the barcode-tagged datasets (Extended Data Fig. 4).
units.rationale: This documents a validation step using orthogonal barcode tagging to verify algorithm accuracy.

units.title: Characterize mCBOs with immunofluorescence
units.text: We first characterized mCBOs by immunofluorescence for canonical markers of neurodevelopment previously defined for organoids differentiated with the same protocol by us and others15,40,41 and confirmed their expected expression patterns (Fig. 2a,b and Extended Data Fig. 1aâ€“c).
units.rationale: This is a direct experimental protocol for validating organoid maturity using established marker staining.
